p.s: In this excerpt from William Shakespeare's The Merchant of Venice Shylock and Tubal two Jewish men meet on a street in Venice.
Shylock has a daughter called Jessica who ran away with a Christian man.
Shylock asked his friend Tubal to help him find his daughter.
Shylock finds himself in a very complicated situation.
Tubal is not able to find his daughter.
On the other hand the bond between Shylock and Antonio is about to break and Shylock can take revenge for things Antonio did to him.
Tubal knows that Shylock's daughter is somewhere in Genoa but not exactly where.
Shylock wants to find his daughter because she took a lot of money with her.
This is a bad situation for Shylock.
On the other hand Shylock has a bond with Antonio.
Antonio is a Christian man who lives in Venice.

Because of Shylock's and Antonio's history, Shylock wants to take revenge so he is very happy about the news Tubal tells him about Antonio.
Tubal tells Shylock that Antonio has no money left and that he is not able to pay Shylock back.
This situation makes him really happy.
All in all one can say that Shylock is in two different situations at the same time.
One of them makes him angry and the other one makes him happy.
